1.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
David, the youngest son of Jesse
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
Shaul, the name of an Edomite and two Israelites

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver

3.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab
a retreat (literally or figuratively); abstractly, a fleeing
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

4.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
without profit, worthlessness; by extension, destruction, wickedness

6.brief: a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

8.brief: to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy

smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish

the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness

to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish

properly, containing, i.e. a tube; also a bed or valley of astream; also a strong thing or a hero

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah
David, the youngest son of Jesse
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
